definitions.definition: Any of many gram-negative bacteria, of the genus Proteus, several of which are responsible for human infections.
An ape or monkey, especially an anthropoid.
Of or pertaining to apes; apelike.
Bearing resemblance to an ape.
To indicate; to mark.
definitions.example: The yellow blazes denote the trail.

definitions.definition: To make overt.
To refer to literally; to convey as meaning.
Each by itself; for or to each one
definitions.example: These melons cost a dollar apiece.

definitions.definition: A cut of quick-cured pork leg.
A victory in backgammon achieved when the opponent has not borne off a single stone.
Backgammon (the game itself).
A rope fastening a bowsprit to the stem of a ship (usually called a gammoning).
Chatter, ridiculous nonsense.
A middle-aged or older right-wing, reactionary white man, or such men collectively.
To cure bacon by salting.
To beat by a gammon (without the opponent bearing off a stone).
To lash with ropes (on a ship).
To deceive; to lie plausibly to.
Having, or employing multiple modes.
(with adverbial of direction) To move quickly and noisily like a storm, usually in a state of uproar or anger.
definitions.example: She stormed out of the room.

definitions.definition: To rage or fume; to be in a violent temper.
To assault (a stronghold or fortification) with military forces.
definitions.example: Troops stormed the complex.

definitions.definition: To have the weather be violent, with strong winds and usually rain, thunder, lightning, or snow.
definitions.example: It stormed throughout the night.

definitions.definition: The act by which something is stormed.
definitions.example: the stormings of cities throughout history

definitions.definition: The act of one who storms or rages.
A small island
An isolated piece of tissue that has a specific function
The sum of everything that exists in the cosmos, including time and space itself.
definitions.example: I think that the universe was created by a life force rather than a deity.

definitions.definition: An entity similar to our universe; one component of a larger entity known as the multiverse.
Everything under consideration.
definitions.example: In all this universe of possibilities, there is only one feasible option.

definitions.definition: A sample taken from the population.
An imaginary collection of worlds.
definitions.example: The universe in this comic book series is richly imagined.

definitions.definition: (films) A collection of stories with characters and settings that are less interrelated than those of sequels or prequels.
A whole world, in the sense of perspective or social setting.
definitions.example: That didn’t just rock my world, it rocked my universe.

definitions.definition: An encapsulated collection of nerve-cell bodies, located outside the brain and spinal cord.
Any of certain masses of gray matter in the brain, as the basal ganglia.
(by extension) A centre of intellectual or industrial force, activity, etc.
A cystic tumour on a tendon sheath or joint capsule; a ganglion cyst.
A pipe or channel for conveying water etc.
A duct or tube into which electrical cables may be pulled; a type of raceway.
A means by which something is transmitted.
An investment vehicle that issues short-term commercial paper to finance long-term off-balance sheet bank assets.
Movement ahead or forward.
Forward motion, or its rate.
The interval of time or distance between the fronts of two vehicles (e.g. buses) moving in succession in the same direction, especially along the same pre-determined route.
Progress toward a goal.
The clearance beneath an object, such as an arch, ceiling or bridge; headroom.
(coal-mining) A cross-heading.
The quality of being resonant.
A resonant sound, echo, or reverberation, such as that produced by blowing over the top of a bottle.
The sound produced by a hollow body part such as the chest cavity upon auscultation, especially that produced while the patient is speaking.
Something that evokes an association, or a strong emotion.
The increase in the amplitude of an oscillation of a system under the influence of a periodic force whose frequency is close to that of the system's natural frequency.
A short-lived subatomic particle or state of atomic excitation that results from the collision of atomic particles.
definitions.example: 2004, When experiments with the first ‘atom-smashers’ took place in the 1950s to 1960s, many short-lived heavier siblings of the proton and neutron, known as ‘resonances’, were discovered. — Frank Close, Particle Physics: A Very Short Introduction (Oxford 2004, p. 35)

definitions.definition: An increase in the strength or duration of a musical tone produced by sympathetic vibration.
The property of a compound that can be visualized as having two structures differing only in the distribution of electrons; mesomerism.
A influence of the gravitational forces of one orbiting object on the orbit of another, causing periodic perturbations.
The condition where the inductive and capacitive reactances have equal magnitude.
A member of a mendicant Christian order such as the Augustinians, Carmelites (white friars), Franciscans (grey friars) or the Dominicans (black friars).
A white or pale patch on a printed page.
An American fish, the silverside.
The state of being subjective.
A subjective thought or idea.
A tree of the Acer genus, characterised by its usually palmate leaves and winged seeds.
The wood of such a tree, prized for its hardness and attractive appearance
To entice; to attract.
The action of the verb allure.
Having the power to allure.
Any of several devices, containing a two-dimensional array of small quantities of biological material, used for various types of assay; the assay itself
A cobblestone.
A particle from 64 to 256 mm in diameter, following the Wentworth scale.
Small flat-bottomed fishing boat suitable for launching from a beach, found on the north-east coast of England and in Scotland.
To make shoes (what a cobbler does).
To assemble in an improvised way.
definitions.example: I cobbled something together to get us through till morning.

definitions.definition: To use cobblestones to pave a road, walkway, etc.
Any of several Old World birds of prey of the genus Buteo with broad wings and a broad tail.
Any scavenging bird such as the American black vulture (Coragyps atratus) or the turkey vulture (Cathartes aura).
(often preceded by "old", the "old buzzard") In North America, a curmudgeonly or cantankerous man; an old person; a mean, greedy person.
A blockhead; a dunce.
A score of two over par (for one hole)
Resembling, having the appearance or consistence of, or relating to bone; osseous.
Full of bones
With little flesh; skinny, thin
Having prominent bones
A device that is used to remove blockages from the drain of a basin or tub, by suction.
The internal piece of a syringe that pushes out or pulls in any contents.
The sliding activator of an exploder, an electrical generator used to trigger electrical detonators such as blasting caps.
The part of a cafetière that is pushed down to remove grounds from coffee.
One who plunges; a diver.
A horse that plunges, or throws itself suddenly forward.
A cavalryman.
A device similar to a piston but without a mechanism; a long solid cylinder used, instead of a piston or bucket, as a forcer in pumps.
The moving portion of a solenoid.
The spring-loaded assembly that propels the ball onto the table.
A reckless gambler.
A boiler in which clay is beaten by a wheel to a creamy consistency.
The firing pin of a breechloader.
To limp; move with a limping gait.
To stand in doubt whether to proceed, or what to do; hesitate; be uncertain; linger; delay; mammer.
To be lame, faulty, or defective, as in connection with ideas, or in measure, or in versification.
To waver.
To falter.
To stop marching.
To stop either temporarily or permanently.
To bring to a stop.
To cause to discontinue.
definitions.example: The contract negotiations halted operations for at least a week.

definitions.definition: The action of one who halts; a stopping or hesitancy.
Prone to pauses or breaks; hesitant; broken.

definitions.definition: A heavy object or moveable support placed at one or both ends of a row of books for the purpose of keeping them upright.
Something that comes before, after, or at both sides of something else.
To come before and after, or at both sides of.

A bent piece of an axle or shaft, or an attached arm perpendicular, or nearly so, to the end of a shaft or wheel, used to impart a rotation to a wheel or other mechanical device; also used to change circular into reciprocating motion, or reciprocating into circular motion.
definitions.example: I grind my coffee by hand with a coffee grinder with a crank handle.

definitions.definition: The act of converting power into motion, by turning a crankshaft.
definitions.example: Yes, a crank was all it needed to start.

definitions.definition: Any bend, turn, or winding, as of a passage.
An ill-tempered or nasty person.
definitions.example: Billy-Bob is a nasty old crank! He chased my cat away.

definitions.definition: A twist or turn of the mind; caprice; whim;
A fit of temper or passion.
(dated in US) A person who is considered strange or odd by others. They may behave in unconventional ways.
definitions.example: John is a crank because he talks to himself.

definitions.definition: (1800s) A baseball fan.
An advocate of a pseudoscience movement.
definitions.example: That crank next door thinks he’s created cold fusion in his garage.

definitions.definition: A twist or turn in speech; word play consisting in a change of the form or meaning of a word.
A sick person; an invalid.
A penis.
A highly addictive phenethylamine stimulant drug, similar to cocaine. Its systematic (IUPAC) name is (S)-N-methyl-1-phenylpropan-2-amine.
To turn by means of a crank.
definitions.example: Motorists had to crank their engine by hand.

definitions.definition: To turn a crank.
definitions.example: He's been cranking all day and yet it refuses to crank.

definitions.definition: (of a crank or similar) To turn.
definitions.example: He's been cranking all day and yet it refuses to crank.

definitions.definition: To cause to spin via other means, as though turned by a crank.
definitions.example: Crank it up!

definitions.definition: To act in a cranky manner; to behave unreasonably and irritably, especially through complaining.
definitions.example: Quit cranking about your spilt milk!

definitions.definition: To be running at a high level of output or effort.
definitions.example: By one hour into the shift, the boys were really cranking.

definitions.definition: To run with a winding course; to double; to crook; to wind and turn.
The source of a river, the set of streams that feed into the river's beginning.
A graphical display of numerical data in the form of upright bars, with the area of each bar representing frequency.
To return to life; to become reanimated or reinvigorated.
To return to life; to cause to recover life or strength; to cause to live anew.

definitions.definition: To recover from a state of oblivion, obscurity, neglect, or depression.

definitions.definition: To restore, or bring again to life; to reanimate.
definitions.example: This new paint job should revive the surgery waiting room.

definitions.definition: To raise from coma, languor, depression, or discouragement; to bring into action after a suspension.
To renew in the mind or memory; to bring to recollection; to recall attention to; to reawaken.

definitions.definition: To recover its natural or metallic state, as a metal.
To restore or reduce to its natural or metallic state

definitions.definition: A revival; a bringing back to life.

A prostitute or woman with loose sexual morals.
Bitch, slut; an insulting epithet applied to a female.
A girlfriend of a bikie.

A mountain.
A hill.
A mound of earth and stones raised over a grave or graves.

An administrative unit of a city which, under most circumstances according to state or national law, would be considered a larger or more powerful entity; most commonly used in American English to define the five counties that make up New York City.
Other similar administrative units in cities and states in various parts of the world.
A district in Alaska having powers similar to a county.
An association of men who gave pledges or sureties to the king for the good behaviour of each other.
The pledge or surety thus given.
A tunnel or hole, often as dug by a small creature.
A heap or heaps of rubbish or refuse.

definitions.definition: The property of being universal, common to all members of a class

An arrangement, categorization or classification of things.

The power to use something or someone.

Not given enough recognition for its quality
The symbol "‐", typically used to join two or more words to form a compound term, or to indicate that a word has been split at the end of a line.
Something that links two more consequential things.
An enclosed walkway or passage that connects two buildings.

To separate or punctuate with a hyphen; to hyphenate.
Used to emphasize the coordinating function usually indicated by the punctuation "-".

In an exquisite manner.

An enemy.

In an unkind or unfriendly manner; not as a friend
A horizontal door in a floor or ceiling.
A trapdoor.
An opening in a wall at window height for the purpose of serving food or other items. A pass through.

An opening through the deck of a ship or submarine
A gullet.

A bedstead.

The act of hatching.
Development; disclosure; discovery.

A birth, the birth records (in the newspaper) — compare the phrase "hatched, matched, and dispatched."

To cross; to spot; to stain; to steep.

definitions.definition: An object that consists of a rim and small hole or perforation to receive a cord or fastener, as in garments, sails, etc. An eyelet may reinforce a hole.

definitions.definition: A shaped metal embellishment containing a hole, used in scrapbook. Eyelets are typically set by punching a hole in the page, placing the smooth side of the eyelet on a table, positioning the paper over protruding edge and curling the edge down using a hammer and eyelet setter.

A peephole.
A little eye.
A large marine fish with a long, pointed bill, Xiphias gladius.

definitions.definition: To press one's body tightly against a surface, such as a wall or floor, especially in order to avoid being seen or harmed.

definitions.definition: To increase in value.

To create anew.

The study of supersonic motion

definitions.definition: (of an insect) To bite.

A small, two-wheeled vehicle, like a Bath chair, to be drawn or pushed by a boy or man.
A sort of Russian salad, originally using French salad dressing.
To order (a drug or medical device) for use by a particular patient (under licensed authority).

A raft or float, used principally on the Pacific coast of South America.

Something that falls in a shower.

A particular race or event in the sport of enduro.
An exhibition of pictures or objects viewed through a small hole or magnifying glass.

A plant of the genus Capparis.
The capercaillie.

To jump as part of a dance.
To engage in playful behaviour.
A condition that is assumed to be true without further evaluation.

definitions.definition: Of, or relating to, money; monetary, financial.

The harvesting of a grape crop and the initial pressing of juice for winemaking.
The year or place in which something is produced.

To assume or suppose; to infer.

(properly) History before written records, inclusive of both

Any of several plants of the genus Lens, especially Lens culinaris, from southwest Asia, that have edible, lens-shaped seeds within flattened pods.
The seed of these plants, used as food.
An essential amino acid C6H9N3O2 found in most animal proteins; essential for tissue growth and repair.
The sound made by a duck.

definitions.definition: The symbol ♯, placed after the name of a note in the key signature or before a note on the staff to indicate that the note is to be played a semitone higher.

definitions.definition: A note that is played a semitone higher than usual; denoted by the name of the note that is followed by the symbol ♯.

definitions.definition: The scale having a particular sharp note as its tonic.

definitions.definition: (usually in the plural) Something that is sharp.

definitions.definition: A dishonest person; a cheater.

definitions.definition: A brushing or cleaning, as of a dog or horse.
definitions.example: Give the mare a quick groom before you take her out.

definitions.definition: To attend to one's appearance and clothing.
To care for (horses or other animals) by brushing and cleaning them.
To prepare (someone) for election or appointment.
To prepare (a ski slope) for skiers by packing down the snow.
To attempt to gain the trust of (somebody, especially a minor) with the intention of subjecting them to abusive or exploitative behaviour such as sexual abuse or human trafficking.
In agile software development, to review and prioritize the items in the development backlog.
The day when God is expected to judge the world; end times.
Judgement day; the day of the Final Judgment; any day of decisive judgement or final dissolution.
Concerned with or predicting future universal destruction.
Given to or marked by forebodings or predictions of impending calamity.
Capable of causing widespread or total destruction.
An aquatic or marine carnivorous mammal in the subfamily Lutrinae of the family Mustelidae, which also includes weasels, polecats, badgers, and others.
A hairy man with a slender physique, in contrast with a bear, who is more thickset.
An alley where there are stables; a narrow passage; a confined place.
A place where birds of prey are housed.
A gull, seagull.
A prison, or other place of confinement.
A hiding place; a secret store or den.
A breeding-cage for birds.
A cage for hawks, especially while moulting.
(in the plural) A building or set of buildings where moulting birds are kept.
The crying sound of a cat; a meow, especially of a kitten.
The crying sound of a gull.
An exclamation of disapproval; a boo.
To shut away, confine, lock up.
(of a bird) To moult.

definitions.definition: (of a bird) To cause to moult.
(of a deer) To shed antlers.
(of a cat, especially of a kitten) To meow.
To flatten the tongue against the roof of the mouth for supposed health benefits.
To expel; to remove.

definitions.definition: To mark the skin permanently.
To form a scar.
To affect deeply in a traumatic manner.

A spontaneous and fanciful series of thoughts while awake not connected to immediate reality.

definitions.definition: A narrow passage or alley.
The univalent anion HCO3-; any salt of carbonic acid in which only one of the hydrogen atoms has been replaced.
Sodium bicarbonate used as a mild antacid; bicarbonate of soda
A large barrel for the storage of liquid, especially of alcoholic drinks.
A casket; a small box for jewels.
A helmet.
A hard structure on the head of some birds, such as the hornbill or cassowary.
To put into a cask.
A person who retails groceries (foodstuffs and household items) from a grocery.
To sell groceries; to act as a grocer.
A person who studies or practices dietetics.
In a speedy or fast manner.
An inn or hostel.
A black person; a person of sub-Saharan African descent.
Powdered spice made from dried and ground fruits of sweet pepper (bell pepper) or chili pepper (cultivars of Capsicum annuum), or mixtures of these (used especially in Hungarian cooking).

(rare, commonly called "dried [bell/chilli] peppers" or "dried capsicums") A dried but not yet ground fruit of sweet pepper (bell pepper) or chili pepper sold for use as a spice.
A bright reddish orange colour resembling that of the ground spice.
Of a bright reddish orange colour, like that of the dried paprika.
The act of one who chases another; a pursuit.
A hunt.
A children's game where one player chases another.
A large country estate where game may be shot or hunted.
Anything being chased, especially a vessel in time of war.
A wild animal that is hunted.
Any of the guns that fire directly ahead or astern; either a bow chase or stern chase.

(real tennis) The occurrence of a second bounce by the ball in certain areas of the court, giving the server the chance, later in the game, to "play off" the chase from the receiving end and possibly win the point.

(real tennis) A division of the floor of a gallery, marked by a figure or otherwise; the spot where a ball falls, and between which and the dedans the adversary must drive the ball in order to gain a point.
One or more riders who are ahead of the peloton and trying to join the race or stage leaders.
A rectangular steel or iron frame into which pages or columns of type are locked for printing or plate-making.
A groove cut in an object; a slot: the chase for the quarrel on a crossbow.

A trench or channel or other encasement structure for encasing (archaically spelled enchasing) drainpipes or wiring; a hollow space in the wall of a building encasing ventilation ducts, chimney flues, wires, cables or plumbing.
The part of a gun in front of the trunnions.
The cavity of a mold.
A kind of joint by which an overlap joint is changed to a flush joint by means of a gradually deepening rabbet, as at the ends of clinker-built boats.
To pursue.
To consume another beverage immediately after drinking hard liquor, typically something better tasting or less harsh such as soda or beer; to use a drink as a chaser
definitions.example: I need something to chase this shot with.

definitions.definition: To attempt to win by scoring the required number of runs in the final innings.
definitions.example: Australia will be chasing 217 for victory on the final day.

definitions.definition: To swing at a pitch outside of the strike zone, typically an outside pitch
To produce enough offense to cause the pitcher to be removed

definitions.definition: To groove; indent.
To place piping or wiring in a groove encased within a wall or floor, or in a hidden space encased by a wall.

definitions.definition: To cut (the thread of a screw).
To decorate (metal) by engraving or embossing.
To become involved in a situation, so as to alter or prevent an action.

definitions.definition: To occur, fall, or come between, points of time, or events.
definitions.example: An instant intervened between the flash and the report.

definitions.definition: To occur or act as an obstacle or delay.

definitions.definition: To say (something) in the middle of a conversation or discussion between other people, or to respond to a situation involving other people.
To come between, or to be between, persons or things.

definitions.definition: In a suit to which one has not been made a party, to put forward a defense of one's interest in the subject matter.

definitions.definition: To refuse to allow

definitions.definition: To reject as invalid, untrue, or improper

definitions.definition: Forbidden
Invalid
The provision of resources.
Mezzo-soprano
Embodied in flesh; given a bodily, especially a human, form; personified.
Flesh-colored, crimson.
Not in the flesh; spiritual.
To embody in flesh, invest with a bodily, especially a human, form.
To incarn; to become covered with flesh, to heal over.
definitions.example: 1760: My uncle Toby’s wound was near well, and as soon as the surgeon recovered his surprize, and could get leave to say as much—he told him, 'twas just beginning to incarnate — Laurence Sterne, The Life & Opinions of Tristram Shandy, Gentleman (Penguin 2003, p. 83)

definitions.definition: To make carnal; to reduce the spiritual nature of.
To put into or represent in a concrete form, as an idea.

definitions.definition: Describing a scientific name that was previously used, a junior homonym.

definitions.definition: To occupy or take possession of beforehand.
A variety of soft, mild French cheese made from cow's milk.

definitions.definition: To graze a surface.

To strike and fly off in an oblique direction; to dart aside.
To hit lightly with the head, make a deft header.
To make an incidental or passing reflection; to allude; to hint; often with at.

A type of interaction between parent fish and offspring in which juveniles swim toward and rapidly touch the sides of the parent, in most cases feeding on parental mucus. Relatively few species glance, mainly some Cichlidae.
A vertical building, usually cylindrical, used for the production of silage.
From the shape, a building used for the storage of grain.
An underground bunker used to hold missiles which may be launched.
An organizational unit that has poor interaction with other units, negatively affecting overall performance.

definitions.definition: A self-enclosed group of like-minded individuals.
A usurper; one who gains power and rules extralegally, distinguished from kings elevated by election or succession.
Any monarch or governor.
A despot; a ruler who governs unjustly, cruelly, or harshly.

(by extension) A villain; a person or thing who uses strength or violence to treat others unjustly, cruelly, or harshly.

definitions.definition: Frivolous, impulsive, inconsistent, changeable.
To make known in a formal manner; to proclaim; to announce; to declare.

To claim the right of working a mine that is abandoned or insufficiently worked.

Appetite; inclination.
Mother.

To make (a person) angry, distressed, or unhappy.

Causing upset; distressing.

Describing the state, aspect, or practice of an abstract concept.

Of the state of an element at the time it is being generated from some compound or transitioning from one state to another; Newly released from a compound (especially hydrogen and oxygen) by a chemical reaction or electrolysis and possessing heightened reactivity; Newly synthesized (especially protein or RNA) by translation or transcription.
A list of items for sale with their prices.
A number by which another (the multiplicand) is to be multiplied.

Any of several devices used to enhance a signal
A multiplier onion.
The act, process, or state of reinforcing or being reinforced.
A thing that reinforces.

A form of hotel having self-catering apartments instead of bedrooms or suites.

The interior flooring of a church sanctuary, between the communion rail and the altar.
Someone who couples things together, especially someone whose job it is to couple railway carriages.
Anything that serves to couple things together; but especially a device that couples railway carriages.

An electrical device used to transfer energy from one electric device to another, especially without a physical connection.
A lotion, gel, or liquid used after finishing shaving
To grumble; to complain in a low, muttering voice, or express discontent at or against someone or something.

To restore (someone) to their former state, reputation, possessions, status etc.

To return (something) to its original condition.

To go through such a process; to recover.
A paten, flat type of dish
The colour or incrustation which age and wear give to (mainly metallic) objects; especially, the green rust which covers works of art such as ancient bronzes, coins and medals.

A gloss or superficial layer.
Of a green colour, tinted with grey, like that of bronze patina.
One who, or that which, propels.

A steamboat thus propelled; a screw steamer.
A spinnerbait.
A person who plays the violin
The study of the way sounds function in languages, including phonemes, syllable structure, stress, accent, intonation, and which sounds are distinctive units within a language.
The way sounds function within a given language; a phonological system.

A mass of cytoplasm, containing many nuclei, created by the aggregation of amoeboid cells of slime molds during their vegetative phase. When capitalised as a proper name, Plasmodium is a genus of protozoan parasites responsible for such diseases as malaria
A small ape of the family Hylobatidae with long limbs, which it uses to travel through rainforests by swinging from branch to branch.
To please.
To make content; to satisfy.
The buttocks.

definitions.definition: The anus.
(sometimes derogatory) A homeless person, usually a man.
A lazy, incompetent, or annoying person, usually a man.

definitions.definition: A player or racer who often performs poorly.

definitions.definition: A drinking spree.
A humming noise.
A bumbailiff.
To sodomize; to engage in anal sex.
To ask someone to give one (something) for free; to beg for something.

Existing, relating to, or made for use beneath the sea.

A pug dog.
To rub, scrub, clean or wipe with a mop, or as if with a mop.
definitions.example: to mop (or scrub) a floor

definitions.definition: To make a wry expression with the mouth.
(of a binary operation) Such that the order in which the operands are taken does not affect their image under the operation.
definitions.example: Addition and multiplication are commutative operations but subtraction and division are not.

definitions.definition: (of an algebraic structure) Having a commutative operation.
(of a diagram of morphisms) Such that any two sequences of morphisms with the same initial and final positions compose to the same morphism.
Relating to exchange; interchangeable.
In a rational manner
Tumultuous, noisy excitement.
Loud confused noise, especially when coming from several sources.
A loud protest, controversy, outrage
To throw into uproar or confusion.
To make an uproar.
A dark-skinned variety of grape, used to produce red wines.
A wine produced from this variety of grape.
An uncivilized or feral human; a barbarian.
A defiant person.
To attack or assault someone or something ferociously or without restraint.
definitions.example: No matter how anyone might savage me, I should stay strong.

definitions.definition: To criticise vehemently.
definitions.example: His latest film was savaged by most reviewers.

definitions.definition: (of an animal) To attack with the teeth.
To make savage.
A hemispherical pit created by the impact of a meteorite or other object.
The basin-like opening or mouth of a volcano, through which the chief eruption comes; similarly, the mouth of a geyser, about which a cone of silica is often built up.
The pit left by the explosion of a mine or bomb.
(by extension) Any large, roughly circular depression or hole.
A living being; an animal or (sometimes derogatory) a human.
definitions.example: He's a creature of habit.   insects and other creatures

definitions.definition: A created thing, whether animate or inanimate; a creation.
A being subservient to or dependent upon another.
An ancient Greek vessel for mixing water and wine.
To form craters in a surface (of a planet or moon).
To collapse catastrophically; to become devastated or completely destroyed.
To crash or fall.
definitions.example: He cratered into that snow bank about five seconds after his first lesson.

definitions.definition: The formation and development of new blood vessels.
A worm of the large phylum Nematoda, such as a roundworm or threadworm.
In an administrative manner.
The action of mocking; ridicule, derision.
Something so lacking in necessary qualities as to inspire ridicule; a laughing-stock.
Something insultingly imitative; an offensively futile action, gesture etc.
Mimicry, imitation, now usually in a derogatory sense; a travesty, a ridiculous simulacrum.
definitions.example: The defendant wasn't allowed to speak at his own trial - it was a mockery of justice.

definitions.definition: A fence or barrier consisting of one or more horizontal rails and vertical supports.
definitions.example: During the war, everyone's railings were taken away to make bombers.

definitions.definition: Railing (a horizontal rail with vertical supports)
A wind blowing from the north.
Facing the north; directed towards the north.
Located in a northern region
Coming from the north.
In an northward direction or position; (towards the) north.
From the north.
To use; to exploit; to manipulate in order to take full advantage (of something).
definitions.example: They plan to leverage off the publicity to get a good distribution agreement.

definitions.definition: The person or thing coming next after the ninth in a series; that which is in the tenth position.
One of ten equal parts of a whole.
The interval between any tone and the tone represented on the tenth degree of the staff above it, as between one of the scale and three of the octave above; the octave of the third.
(in the plural) A temporary aid issuing out of personal property, and granted to the king by Parliament; formerly, the real tenth part of all the movables belonging to the subject.
Relating to or affected with cancer.
Growing or spreading rapidly to the point of harm.
Extremely unpleasant; detestable.
The abnormal termination of operation of a superconducting magnet, occurring when part of the superconducting coil enters the normal (resistive) state.
A rapid change of the parameters of a physical system.
To satisfy, especially an actual or figurative thirst.
definitions.example: The library quenched her thirst for knowledge.

definitions.definition: To extinguish or put out (as a fire or light).
To cool rapidly by dipping into a bath of coolant, as a blacksmith quenching hot iron.
definitions.example: The swordsmith quenched the sword in an oil bath so that it wouldn't shatter.

definitions.definition: To terminate or greatly diminish (a chemical reaction) by destroying or deforming the remaining reagents.
To rapidly change the parameters of a physical system.
One who succeeds in passing a test, etc.
Someone who passes, someone who makes a pass.
A passed pawn.
One who passes; a passer-by.
One who is able to "pass", or be accepted as a member of a race, sex or other group to which society would not otherwise regard them as belonging.
To form a circle around; to encircle.
To include within its scope; to circumscribe or go round so as to surround; to enclose; to contain.
To include completely; to describe fully or comprehensively.
definitions.example: This book on English grammar encompasses all irregular verbs.

definitions.definition: To go around, especially, to circumnavigate.
definitions.example: Drake encompassed the globe.

definitions.definition: The act of reassessing; a second or subsequent assessment.
Food prepared by broiling.
A brawl; a rowdy disturbance.
definitions.example: come to broils

definitions.definition: To cook by direct, radiant heat.
To expose to great heat.
To be exposed to great heat.
To cause a rowdy disturbance; embroil.
To brawl.
A cheer; a cry of hurrah!.
To give a hurrah (to somebody).
Expressing approval, appreciation, or happiness.
Something that chills
A frightening dramatic work, such as a book or film
In a modest manner.
An inscription on a gravestone in memory of the deceased.
A poem or other short text written in memory of a deceased person.
To write or speak after the manner of an epitaph.
To commemorate by an epitaph.
A violent uprising of part or all of a national population against the government or other authority.
Recurrence of a woman's periods; menstruation.
The quality of being periodic; tendency to recur at regular intervals.
The quality of a function with a repeated set of values at regular intervals.
To leave the country in which one lives, especially one's native country, in order to reside elsewhere.
A digestive enzyme that cleaves peptide bonds (a serine protease)
A monetary award to university students that allows them to continue their studies.
The treasury of a religious order or public institution.
The characteristic of being dependable; the ability to be depended upon.
The act of overdrawing a bank account.
The amount overdrawn.
definitions.example: I have an overdraft of £1234.

definitions.definition: The maximum amount that may be overdrawn.
definitions.example: The bank have given me an overdraft of $2000.

definitions.definition: The extraction of groundwater from an aquifer beyond the safe yield or equilibrium yield.
A series of flues in a furnace; the current of air forced through them.
To extract groundwater from (an aquifer) beyond the safe yield or equilibrium yield.
Any infectious bacterium of the genus Mycoplasma, often specifically Mycoplasma pneumoniae
A large flat-bottomed towed or self-propelled boat used mainly for river and canal transport of heavy goods or bulk cargo.
A richly decorated ceremonial state vessel propelled by rowers for river processions.
A large flat-bottomed coastal trading vessel having a large spritsail and jib-headed topsail, a fore staysail and a very small mizen, and having leeboards instead of a keel.
One of the boats of a warship having fourteen oars
The wooden disk in which bread or biscuit is placed on a mess table.
A double-decked passenger or freight vessel, towed by a steamboat.
A large omnibus used for excursions.
To intrude or break through, particularly in an unwelcome or clumsy manner.
To push someone.
The back; the dorsal aspect of the thorax in insects.
